revised_title: Nervous Control and Composition of Tracheal Mucus in Cats
tldr: The authors developed a new method to measure tracheal mucus output in cats and studied the effects of nervous and pharmacological stimuli on mucus secretion. They found that sympathetic nerve stimulation and sympathomimetic amines increase tracheal mucus output, while parasympathetic nerve stimulation also increases mucus protein output. The mucus collected was analyzed chemically, revealing two groups of glycoproteins and the main monosaccharides present in tracheal mucus glycoproteins.
